intro: Cephalocarpus erectolaxus, commonly known as the erect lax flowerhead plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spherical clusters at the ends of its stems. Its botanical features include narrow, grass-like leaves and a compact growth habit. It is often found in dry, open habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
